About Intramural Sports
Fall 2025 INTRAMURAL REGISTRATION
Registration for Fall 2025 intramurals opens Monday, August 25th @ 12:00pm.
Check here for how to register your team!
INTRAMURALS AT USF
Intramural Sports at the University of South connects and unifies students, faculty,
               and staff across multiple campuses through diverse recreational sports and activities.
               We engage the community through experiences that create lasting memories and build
               lifelong friendships. We are more than just sports; we are fun, we are family, we
               are IMs!
INTRAMURAL SPORTS OFFICE HOURS
Our office is located in the Campus Recreation Center (REC 017) and is open Monday
               through Friday, 11:00am - 3:00pm.
Our team will be glad to field your questions via email at
rec-imsports@usf.edu
.

Overview
AT A GLANCE
Founded in 1956
Nearly 50,000 students
Students from 68 countries
14 colleges across three campuses
SACSCOC accredited
16,000 employees
Enrollment Data from Fall 2024
Full List of USF Facts
Founded in 1956, the University of South Florida is rich with tradition, known for
               our academic excellence, groundbreaking research, service to surrounding communities
               and wide-ranging student opportunities.
Situated in the vibrant
Tampa Bay region with campuses in Tampa,
St. Petersburg
and
Sarasota-Manatee
, USF serves
nearly 50,000 students from almost 70 countries across our three branch campuses.
Strong Academics
USF offers more than 200 programs from
14 colleges
including undergraduate majors, minors and concentrations as well as undergraduate,
               graduate, specialist and professional degrees.
Ranked among the top
50 public universities
in the U.S. for six years in a row (U.S. News & World Report), USF is also recognized
               as the
#1 “best value”
among all universities in Florida, public or private.
Research that matters
As a member of the
Association of American Universities (AAU)
, USF is now among the top research schools in North America.
With a total
annual
economic impact of $6.02 billion,
USF supports 68,704 jobs in the state.
Our faculty and students are working on real-world problems, conducting research that
               impacts and improves lives—locally and around the world.
USF Health
As Tampa Bay’s only academic medical center,
USF Health
thrives in partnership with:
Morsani College of Medicine (ranked
No. 1 in the state
)
College of Nursing
College of Public Health
Taneja College of Pharmacy
School of Physical Therapy & Rehabilitation Sciences
Biomedical Sciences Graduate & Postdoctoral Programs
and USF Health’s multispecialty physicians group
Together, USF Health, in partnership with
Tampa General Hospital
, continues to integrate education, research, and patient care, working toward our
               shared value: Making Life Better.
A Place to belong and grow
At USF, we believe every student will succeed if given the opportunity. Here, students do
               more than attend class; They get involved, explore ideas, and prepare for their future.
From academic support to career planning, we help students reach their goals. We invite
               you to explore more about our university—in person and online—to discover how you
               can prosper at USF.
USF joins prestigious AAU
USF’s historic invitation to join the
Association of American Universities
has taken what many in Tampa Bay have once considered a “best-kept secret” to an
                        unprecedented new level. Being an AAU member is a tremendous milestone for USF as
                        it formalizes USF's position as a leading research university.
As the first public university in florida to
be invited to join the AAU in nearly 40 years, USF is proud to now be one of only
                        two
institutions from
the State University System of Florida to serve as an AAU member.

USF
AT A GLANCE
Across the World
You can find approximately 394,000 USF graduates worldwide.
Global Reach
USF is home to approximately 50,000 students from 146 countries!
A New Generation
25% of USF students are first generation. Your support enables them to create a new cycle of education within their families.
Supporting Veterans
U.S. News and World Report ranked USF Tampa as a Best College for Veterans (2023)
Innovative Inventions
USF professors and students were awarded 314 patents over three years.
Faculty Fulbright Scholars
USF leads the nation as the top producer of faculty Fulbright Scholars! Way to go Bulls!
A Smart Investment
U.S. News & World Report ranks USF as the “best value” among all public universities in Florida (2023).
AAU Member
USF is a member of the Association of American Universities, the most prestigious association in higher education.
A Leading University
U.S. News & World Report ranks USF #45 among public universities (2024).

About Us
USF IT is an energetic and passionate team of experts who are committed to university success.
USF Health
Information Technology
About Us
About Us
Vision & Mission
USF IT will lead the use of disruptive technology to achieve USF Goals. Through a culture of excellence, we partner with our clients to implement innovative and impactful technology across USF.
USF Information Technology
(USF IT) provides technology services and support for USF, including campuses in Tampa (including USF Health), St. Petersburg and Sarasota-Manatee. The IT team, led by Sidney Fernandes, Vice President and CIO, provides the following services.
Click to Expand
Client Support
IT provides clients with a digital workplace that enables eﬀective performance. Services include desktop and software management, printers, storage solutions, research computing, and much more.
Click to Expand
Cybersecurity Services
IT reduces risk of cybersecurity threats by protecting USF’s technology assets. Services include secure computing such as data protection and encryption, and vulnerability scans.
Click to Expand
Administrative Systems
IT enables efficient administrative functions by providing systems that support the achievement of institutional goals. Services include access & management of student, business, & public safety systems as well as facilitating integration between these systems.
Click to Expand
Analytics & Reporting
IT enables decision makers by providing a full range of reporting and business intelligence tools. Services include data analysis and mining, predictive analytics, creation of interactive dashboards, data visualization, and ad hoc reports.
Click to Expand
Web
IT empowers the USF community to engage their clients using dynamic, secure and recognizable web and mobile solutions. Services include custom application development, business process automation solutions, website hosting and management, web content management, user experience analysis, MyUSF enhancements, and mobile app development.
Click to Expand
Teaching & Learning
IT supports achievement of student success by fostering a 21st century teaching and learning environment. Services include academic support resources such as Canvas, technology in classrooms and smart computing labs, lecture capture, and more.
Click to Expand
Communication Services
IT promotes information sharing through communication and collaboration, enabling the USF community to work together effectively. Services include online collaboration, video conferencing, messaging, email, event services, and digital signage.
Click to Expand
Consulting Services
IT assists clients in optimizing use of technology to solve challenging institutional needs. Services include research consulting, visualization, 3D modeling, project management, process improvement, new technology solution evaluations, and more.
Click to Expand

USF Riverfront Park
First Year Adventure Trips
Challenge Course Events
Event Schedule & Registration
All events take place at the Riverfront Park Challenge Course. To register, click
               the event dates below and sign in to your USF Account.
A signed waiver is required and is available on the ropes course website for printing
               or you can fill it out at the event. There is a maximum weight limit of 300lbs. Participants
               must wear closed toed shoes.
Please contact our team (challengecourse@usf.edu) to cancel. Cancellations must be
                  received 1 week before event for full refund.
Events & Descriptions
Adventure Climb
Cost
: $15
Semesters
: Fall/Spring
Description
: Get harnessed up and challenge yourself on three different levels. If you've ever
                     seen the course and wanted to try it, this is your chance!
Test your balance, make the leap across the Bulls Bridge, swing from rope to rope,
                     and exit on our 500ft Zip line!
Height's Night
Cost
: $10
Semesters
: Fall/Spring
Description
: Get lit on our glow-in-the-dark Challenge Course! You'll be illuminated with glow
                     sticks while conquering obstacles 50ft in the air  (No Zipline)!
Night Zip
Cost
: $10
Semesters
: Fall/Spring
Description
: What's better than ziplining? Ziplining under the stars, of course! As the sun sets,
                     helmet lights are turned on, and your ultimate adventure begins. You don't want to
                     miss out on this after-hours zipline experience.
Women's Climb (Free)
Cost
: Free
Semesters
: Spring
Description
: This event, at the USF Challenge Course, is for all students who identify as women.
                     Climb a series of obstacles all while being surrounded by a community of women. Come
                     as your true self and leave with some new friends!
Climate Climb (Free)
Cost
: Free
Semesters
: Spring (Earth Day)
Description
: In celebration of Earth Day, the USF Challenge Course is collaborating with the
                     Climate Action Coalition to empower participants to take action on one of the biggest
                     challenges facing the planet: climate change. As you climb the course, you'll learn
                     steps you can take to reduce your ecological footprint and expand your global impact.
Cupid Target Practice
Cost
: $10
Semesters
: Spring
Description
: Love is in the air…literally! Climb up to our zipline and soar down while attempting
                     to hit cupids target with bean bags. Register now while space is available! It's sure
                     to be an unforgettable night!
Bull's Eye Target Practice
Cost
: $10
Semesters
: Fall/Spring
Description
: Throwing bean bags at targets sound easy? Try doing it in the air while ziplining
                     down our 500 ft zipline. Let the challenge begin!

Faculty & Staff
You are a pioneer — a driving force on a mission to improve the University of South
                     Florida. With boundless energy and endless ideas, you motivate our community to achieve
                     more every day.
Breadcrumb Navigation
USF Home
About USF
Faculty & Staff
As essential members of USF, your talent, tenacity, and commitment to excellence has
               helped drive our university to new heights. And with your vision, we are just getting
               started. We are proud you are part of the herd, and we wouldn’t be where we are today
               without your dedication, determination, and loyalty to our institution.
Work at USF
Faculty and staff are the lifeblood of an academic institution and central to the
                     performance trajectory of the University of South Florida. Apply to work at USF, where
we advance communities and transform lives.
For Faculty
For Staff
Benefits
As a member of our diverse and talented workforce, you deserve an outstanding employee
                     experience. From essential benefits like health insurance and retirement plans to
                     optional programs for enrichment and work/life balance, the USF Division of Human
                     Resources has got you covered!
Professional Development
At USF, we provide endless opportunities for faculty and staff to learn, grow, and
                     achieve more. From technology training to furthering your research, we foster the
                     environment for you to challenge yourself and grow in your career.
For Faculty
For Staff
Promotion & Tenure
USF recognizes and rewards faculty and staff for their immeasurable contributions
                     to the university. We create an
atmosphere that encourages you to develop and share different ideas and divergent
                     views and to make inquiries unbounded by present norms. For faculty,
tenure
contributes significantly to the creation of such an environment.
Employee Success Center
As a valued member of the USF community, we provide
boundless resources for your success in Bulls Country. From a smooth onboarding process,
                     to learning, networking, and recognition opportunities, to wellness and performance
                     management, we make your transition to USF and beyond as enriching as possible.
Perks & Discounts
We know there’s nothing better than being a Bull, and local businesses feel the same!
                  Enjoy a range of discounts of goods, services and recreation, in the Tampa Bay area
                  and beyond, reserved for employees of USF.

About Fitness
About Us
Discover a new level of fitness with USF RecWell! Our comprehensive Fitness Program
               has something for everyone, from personalized guidance with our expert Personal Trainers
               to over 60 energizing Group Fitness classes each week. Dive into Small Group Training
               for a more intimate, motivational experience, and take advantage of our free Fitness
               Assessments and Wellness Check-Ins to track your progress and stay on track. Elevate
               your fitness journey with us and achieve your goals in a supportive, dynamic environment!
Group Fitness
Elevate your workout game with USF RecWell’s Group Fitness Program! Join the excitement
               of our Cycle Concert Series, get pumped with Les Mills classes, or find your zen in
               Power and Gentle Yoga. Dance it out with Zumba, push your limits in Boxing BootCamp,
               sculpt and tone with Barre and Pilates, and challenge yourself with TRX. Whether you’re
               looking to sweat it out or stretch it out, our diverse class lineup offers something
               for every fitness enthusiast.
Come find your perfect class
and reach your goals with us!
Personal Training
Transform your fitness journey with USF RecWell's Personal Training Program! Whether
               you’re aiming for personalized one-on-one sessions or fun and motivating buddy training,
               we’ve got you covered. Our expert trainers offer detailed Body Composition Scans and
               Fitness Assessments to tailor a program just for you. Get ready to achieve your goals
               with customized support and top-notch guidance. Let’s make your fitness dreams a reality
               together!
Learn more about all of our training services here
.

Faculty & Staff
You are a pioneer — a driving force on a mission to improve the University of South
                     Florida. With boundless energy and endless ideas, you motivate our community to achieve
                     more every day.
Breadcrumb Navigation
USF Home
About USF
Faculty & Staff
As essential members of USF, your talent, tenacity, and commitment to excellence has
               helped drive our university to new heights. And with your vision, we are just getting
               started. We are proud you are part of the herd, and we wouldn’t be where we are today
               without your dedication, determination, and loyalty to our institution.
Work at USF
Faculty and staff are the lifeblood of an academic institution and central to the
                     performance trajectory of the University of South Florida. Apply to work at USF, where
we advance communities and transform lives.
For Faculty
For Staff
Benefits
As a member of our diverse and talented workforce, you deserve an outstanding employee
                     experience. From essential benefits like health insurance and retirement plans to
                     optional programs for enrichment and work/life balance, the USF Division of Human
                     Resources has got you covered!
Professional Development
At USF, we provide endless opportunities for faculty and staff to learn, grow, and
                     achieve more. From technology training to furthering your research, we foster the
                     environment for you to challenge yourself and grow in your career.
For Faculty
For Staff
Promotion & Tenure
USF recognizes and rewards faculty and staff for their immeasurable contributions
                     to the university. We create an
atmosphere that encourages you to develop and share different ideas and divergent
                     views and to make inquiries unbounded by present norms. For faculty,
tenure
contributes significantly to the creation of such an environment.
Employee Success Center
As a valued member of the USF community, we provide
boundless resources for your success in Bulls Country. From a smooth onboarding process,
                     to learning, networking, and recognition opportunities, to wellness and performance
                     management, we make your transition to USF and beyond as enriching as possible.
Perks & Discounts
We know there’s nothing better than being a Bull, and local businesses feel the same!
                  Enjoy a range of discounts of goods, services and recreation, in the Tampa Bay area
                  and beyond, reserved for employees of USF.

Aquatics
overview
We provide aquatic opportunities to the USF community regardless of age, background,
               or ability with a safe and engaging environment. Visit us at our indoor multipurpose
               natatorium, or our FIT leisure pool in
The Village
.
We strive to provide our users with a safe and engaging environment at our aquatic
               facilities. Our facilities are supervised by American Red Cross Lifeguards, who are
               continually trained to meet the highest standard as a professional rescuer.
We offer a variety of opportunities for USF Bulls and the community to engage in our
               program through either American Red Cross courses, SCUBA classes, log rolling, pool
               volleyball and pool golf. In addition, we also host a variety of speciality events,
               so make sure to check in on our social media pages for more fun and upcoming events!
The hours at the our facilities can vary depending on holidays, facility closures,
               and special events,
so please check our main page about possible closures
. Follow
@usfrecwell
for weather updates and closures.
Contact Us:
Ashley Santurri
aeolmsted@usf.edu
Aquatics Coordinator
Aubrey Sargent
Head Lifeguard, WSI
Caitlyn Patton
Head Lifeguard, LGI
Justin Dougherty
Head Lifeguard, Programs
Reggie Demechko
Head Lifeguard, Admin
REC | Indoor Pool
The Indoor Pool at the Recreation & Wellness is a heated, 25 yard, 8 lane lap pool
                     with training equipment available, as well as a remote-controlled ADA chair lift.
FIT | Outdoor Pool
The FIT Pool is a heated resort-style facility with two 25-yard lap lanes, zero-depth
                     entry, built-in seating areas, and ADA accommodations. All surrounded by excellent
                     deck space for sun bathing and a shaded terrace for studying and socializing.
Located in
the Village
across from Summit Hall.

Fall Adventure Trips
Find what fall adventures await you and explore our Adventure Trips offerings!
From day trip to a weekend getaway, hiking high into the Appalachian Mountains or
                     paddling on a surf board in the waters of Cocoa Beach, the opportunities for finding
                     adventures are endless!

FIRST YEAR STUDENTS
Starting college is a big step—and we’re here to help make it unforgettable. The
               Recreation & Wellness Department’s First Year Adventure Trips are designed specifically
               for incoming first-year students at USF.
These peer-led, nature-based experiences are more than just a getaway—they’re a launchpad
               for your college journey.Whether you're hiking through Florida’s scenic trails, paddling
               along peaceful rivers, or camping under the stars, you’ll build friendships, confidence,
               and a deeper connection to your new home at USF.

About
Learn more about our adventure trips
USF RecWell’s Adventure Trip Program eliminates barriers for you to get outdoors and
                     connect with the natural world on various adventures.
Do you want to try something new, meet new people, or see fascinating things in nature?
                     How about all three! Most of our trips are beginner friendly, additionally transportation,
                     gear, food, and trip leaders are provided.
So whether you want to explore Florida more through our Passport to Florida programs,
                     travel throughout the United States on trips experience nature through activities
                     like hiking, caving, whitewater rafting, and backpacking, or you want to take a journey
                     outside the US on one of our Adventure Abroad trips, we have an adventure for everyone!
In addition to pre-planned experiences, we offer custom trips for student organizations,
                     friend groups, or University departments!
Registration
Learn how to register for adventure trips
Don't see a trip that piques your interest? Not a problem! Reach out to
adventure@usf.edu
to get more info about setting up your very own Custom Adventure Trip!
What's Included
Find out what's included in our adventure trips
What to Expect
Learn more about what to expect on your adventure trip
On most trips, you don’t need any experience. Really! If a trip requires experience,
                     we’ll indicate what experience you should have on the Registration page.
After signing up for a trip, within 1-2 weeks before the trip your Trip Leader will
                     reach out with all of the information you will need, including meet up location, what
                     you need to pack, and any other specifics for your trip.
Overnight trips will include a pre-trip meeting. This meeting is mandatory for trip
                     participants. It will include valuable information, such as appropriate clothing,
                     necessary gear, what food to bring, the trip plan, and any necessary paperwork.Once
                     you sign up staff will be in contact about 2-3 weeks before the trip to schedule this
                     meeting.
Types of Adventures
Learn about the types of trips we adventure on
Not sure what kind of adventure you’re seeking? Maybe these categories will help you
                     narrow down what you’re looking for!
Local Adventure
– Explore Tampa Bay and it’s natural setting whether it is on the bike on Downtown’s
                     Riverwalk, kayaking through Weedon Island, or walking through Ybor City.
Urban Exploration
- Adventure is everywhere, we will experience some of the great outdoors around some
                     of our favorite urban areas.
Passport to Florida
- See the real Florida at some of America’s best State Parks and natural beauties
                     all across the state including springs, beaches, and forests.
Classic
- Hiking, trekking, biking, paddling, and camping adventures, made for beginners and
                     outdoor types.
Appalachian Adventure
– Come with us on a trip to the mountains. We will explore one of the oldest mountain
                     ranges on the Earth; hiking, camping, and backpacking through its rolling peaks and
                     cascading waterfalls.
Adventure With Confidence
- Come out and learn a new skill or improve your current skills. These trips are meant
                     to provide a hands-on experience for anyone wanting to try new ways to get outside!
Adventure Abroad
- Want to travel the world, off the beaten path? Take trips around the world, exploring
                     some of nature’s most specular places and immersing ourselves in the local culture.
                     Getting to spend time outdoors in remote landscapes, as well as explore the local
                     culture in cities and towns along the way.
Nature Rx
– Reconnect with the natural world and yourself. Discover awe-inspiring destinations
                     combined with rejuvenating activities like mindfulness walks, plant identification,
                     yoga and meditation to recharge the body and nourish the mind.
Trips Policies
Review our adventure trips policies
We want our trips to be safe, fun, and memorable.
Due to weather and other safety concerns, trip itineraries are subject to change.Trip
                        Leaders will communicate any changes in a timely manner.
Outdoor Recreation practices strong Leave No Trace ethics. (LNT.org) Pack it in, pack
                        it out!
All students participating in Recreation & Wellness Programs are expected to follow
                        the University of South Florida Student Code of Conduct. Should violations of said
                        Code occur, participants risk expulsion from the trip and barring from participation
                        in future programs.
Outdoor Recreation does not condone disrespectful use of language and/or violence
                        towards participants on any of our trips. Use of such language or actions could result
                        in expulsion from the program.  We strive to create a community space where meaningful
                        dialogues and personal growth can take place.
Adventure Trips are Alcohol Alternative Programs, therefore no alcohol is allowed
                        to be consumed during the trip. Any underage consumption could result in University
                        judicial consequences.
No illicit drugs or drug paraphernalia
are allowed on trips in any fashion.  Breach of this rule will result in an immediate
                        expulsion from the trip and could result in University judicial consequences.
We reserve the right to cancel a program due to inclement weather, natural disasters,
                        or extenuating circumstances
In the event we must cancel a program, a full trip refund will be provided.
You can find the full refund policy on the Trip Registration page.

USF Challenge Course
EDITABLE SECTION
The USF Challenge Course provides personal development and teambuilding programs in
               a safe, challenging, and supportive environment that promotes a deeper awareness of
               ourselves, others, and the natural world.
Contact our Challenge Course Team with any questions or feedback (
challengecourse@usf.edu
).
Work With Us
Looking for a job with Recreation & Wellness, come join our team of challenge course
               facilitators. More information about
information sessions and applications can be found here
.
Overview
Group Reservations
The USF Challenge Course uses a series of teambuilding games and activities to help
               groups develop leadership, problem solving, and communication skills. This course
               is a fantastic and engaging way to encourage team bonding, learning how to tackle
               challenges, and strengthening your team!
The fifty-foot high course emphasizes healthy risk-taking and trust, with three levels
               filled with twenty unique challenges that enable participants to expand and grow out
               of their comfort zones. Once at the top, participants can choose to take the ultimate
               leap of faith on our zip line, soaring over the Riverfront Park!
All group reservations include:
One-on-one collaboration with a Lead Facilitator
A customized teambuilding curriculum
Full use of our Challenge Course tents, tables, and benches
See our
Group Reservation
page to learn more!
Challenge Course Events
Want to experience the Challenge Course, but don’t have a group? Our Challenge Course Events
               are the perfect way for USF Students, Faculty, Staff, and the USF Community to enjoy
               the Challenge Course without a group reservation!
Check out our
Challenge Course Events
page to learn more!
Frequently Asked Questions
How do I make a teambuilding reservation?
Fill out the
Reservation Request Form
This request
must
be submitted a minimum of
one month
prior to the requested date(s)
Once received, you will be contacted with paperwork within 5 business days.
Any questions, please email
challengecourse@usf.edu
Once a contract is signed, your course is officially reserved; you can change the
                        number of reserved participants up to two weeks before event date
A Lead Facilitator assigned to your group will contact you within two weeks of your
                        reserved date to create your custom teambuilding curriculum
When can I expect to hear back from my reservation request?
Please allow up to 5 business days for a response. We will get back to you as soon
                     as we are able to.
What is the minimum for group size?
Eight participants is the minimum for a group reservation.
Do you have to be USF affiliated to make a reservation?
No, we serve the USF population and its surrounding community. Prices vary based on
                     type of group.
What is the timeframe/minimum time for a program?
It is a minimum of 2 hours for a Lows Teambuilding program and a minimum of 3 hours
                     for a Highs Teambuilding program.
What is the minimum age to go on the Challenge Course?
We do not have an age minimum or limit for Lows Teambuilding.
For our High Ropes Course, participants must be able to fit into a harness and helmet
                     without it falling below their hips or off their head to participate in High Teambuilding
                     on the Challenge Course.
Do I need to know my billing information prior to submitting a reservation request?
It is not required until you sign a contract.
Will transportation be provided?
Transportation is provided for all Challenge Course Events. Transportation is not
                     provided for all Teambuilding Reservations.
What are your COVID-19 policies?
We will be following COVID-19 precautions during your event. The below precautions
                     are recommended:
Usage of hand sanitizer before and after touching any props/teambuilding materials
Having group members bring their own food and water
How do I become a part of the Challenge Course team?
We hire twice a year. Once in early October and again in late Feb/early March. If
                     you are interested in joining our team, please email your resume and a cover letter
                     to Shea Van Alstyne, Challenge Course Coordinator, at
ssvanalstyne@usf.edu
.
What is the cost to reserve the Challenge Course?
You can find our pricing information on the
Group Reservations
page.

Overview
The USF Board of Trustees is the public body corporate of the university. It sets
               cost-effective policy for the institution and serves as the legal owner and governing
               board. The Board of Trustees is responsible for high quality education programs within
               the laws of the State of Florida and regulations of the Florida Board of Governors.
               It holds the institution’s resources in trust and is responsible for their efficient
               and effective use as per Florida Statute 1.001 University Board of Trustees Powers
               and Duties.
The Board of Trustees is comprised of thirteen members, six whom are appointed by
               the Florida Governor and five whom are appointed by the Florida Board of Governors
               and confirmed by the Florida Senate for a term of five years. The elected Faculty
               Senate President and Student Government President also serve as trustees.
Per Section 1004.341(5), Florida Statute, the Board of Trustees must publish on its
               website a
biennial regional impact report
, beginning July 1, 2021, which details the specific increased investments in university
               programs located in Pinellas, Manatee, and Sarasota Counties.

About This Site
The University of South Florida (USF) website is governed by USF's
Office of University Communications and Marketing
. These websites are maintained by communications professionals across campus, with
               the goal of presenting relevant, timely and accurate information to the millions of
               people who visit the site each year.
Technology Notes
The USF website is built with web standards, including HTML5 and CSS3, and utilizes
               responsive design techniques.
Privacy
USF does not collect personal information about you when you visit an official USF
               website, unless you affirmatively choose to make such information available.
USF’s servers automatically recognize the domain and IP address from which you accessed
               the website and record related information such as: information about operating systems,
               screen resolutions and the volume and timing of access to enable interacting with
               the site more accessible, informative and enjoyable. This information does not result
               in the identification of your personal e-mail address, home address, or personal phone
               number.
Many pages within usf.edu use tracking services to help us understand how our visitors
            use our sites. Those can be, but are not limited to:
Google Analytics and Google Advertising Features
(Google Analytics Security and Privacy Principles
)
Siteimprove (
Siteimprove Services Privacy Policy
)
Microsoft Clarity (
Microsoft Privacy Statement
)
Visit each company's privacy information for more details about they use this data.
If you choose to share information with USF - either by sending a message or filling
               out an electronic form with personal information - USF will use the information only
               for the intended purpose. Some records containing personal information must be retained
               for a designated period of time in order to comply with Florida's record retention
               policies and Florida law.. Except as provided for herein, USF does not have an established
               practice of disclosing personal information in its possession to third parties without
               permission unless USF determines that such disclosure is in accordance with a contractual
               agreement with a service provider or is otherwise required by Florida or federal law.
               USF does not sell or disclose personal information for financial gain.
Under Florida law, emails sent to USF employees may be considered public records.
                  If you do not want your email address released in response to a public records request,
                  do not send electronic mail to USF. Instead, make contact by phone or in writing.
Please be aware that as a large, public research university, there are many websites
               within the usf.edu domain. This policy relates to those websites on which USF conducts
               its official business. Because USF encourages the development and deployment of technology
               in an environment of academic freedom, USF cannot ensure that all websites within
               the usf.edu domain are in strict compliance with this policy at all times.
USF reserves the right to amend these privacy terms at any time without notice. The
               privacy, record retention and public records obligations of USF are governed by applicable
               Florida statutes and U.S. federal laws only.
Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA)
The Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) gives students the right to
               refuse to permit USF to publish or disclose items of Directory Information pertaining
               to them. In the course of conducting official USF business, applicant and student
               personal information may be shared with third parties who USF determines have a legitimate
               educational interest in such information or where otherwise permitted by Florida and
               federal law.  For more details, and to view and control the level of disclosure permitted
               for the Student Directory Information, please visit the
Office of the Registrar's website
.
Accessibility
USF is committed to providing all individuals access to our digital resources. We strive
                     to make our web sites and digital content accessible by assuring compatibility with
                     assistive technologies.
Our accessibility standard is:
Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 Level AA
.
Reporting a Digital Access Barrier
USF uses multiple content management systems and applications to deliver our services
               to the public.
If you are having difficulty viewing or interacting with any digital resource, you
               may report it to us by completing the
Digital Access Barrier Report form
.
Your concern will be reviewed in a timely manner. Appropriate campus subject matter
               experts will be consulted as needed. We will provide an initial response to your concern
               within 2 business days. We will resolve the complaint within 7 business days by removing
               the access barrier or implementing a remediation plan.

First Year Adventure Trips
Boating
EDITABLE SECTION
Canoeing and kayaking passes are now sold at the boathouse. We accept Visa or Mastercard
               only. You must have your USF ID or Alumni USF ID card in order to rent a boat.
Stand Up paddle are now available to rent for
$5
per board for up to 2 hours. Renters must follow the regular boating rules and wear
               a life jacket. Boards cannot be reserved and are available on a first come, first
               served basis.
Boat Rental Options
Two & Three Person Canoes
Single Person Kayaks
Two Person Kayaks
Stand Up Paddleboard
Single Boat Rental
Single daily boat rental for canoes and 2 person kayaks is $10.00 per boat for up
               to 2 hours. Single daily boat rental for 1 person kayaks and stand up paddle boards
               is $5.00 per boat for up to 2 hours. Each single daily boat rental is valid for one
               canoe, kayak (single or double), or stand up paddle board. One person with a valid
               USF ID or Alumni ID card will be able to rent up to 2 boats for the rental period.
               No refunds are issued for unused hours in the rental period.
Full Usage Pass
Sold for all the boating services at the park for an entire semester except Moonlight
               Canoeing. A full usage pass entitles the holder to take a canoe for up to two hours
               during the week or the weekend. Cost of the semester full usage pass is
$45.00
. Full usage holders may receive special coupons and discounts on Outdoor Rec Items.
Moonlight Canoeing
Join us on the Hillsborough River at dusk or in the dark for Moonlight Canoeing. Boats
               will launch from the USF Riverfront Park Boathouse at 6550 E Fletcher Ave Tampa, FL
               33647 (Fletcher Ave and the Hillsborough River). Bring your ID to the boathouse to
               check in.
Register for Moonlight Canoeing here!
Current USF ID or valid Alumni Association membership card required for ALL rentals
                  and entrance into Riverfront Park. No Exceptions!

About Recreation & Wellness
OUr Mission
We inspire the USF Community to Achieve Wellness and Success through Recreation Programs
               and Services.
Our Values
Student Development and Success
We serve and support student success through experiential learning opportunities and
                        recreational programs that enrich the student experience.
We cultivate a work environment that supports the growth of student and staff employees
                        in a professional setting.
We create and strengthen a student’s sense of belonging on campus.
Belonging
We are dedicated to creating a welcoming environment that reflects the dynamic needs
                        of the USF and surrounding community.
Wellness
We empower ownership of holistic well-being through cultivating healthy habits toward
                        personal and lifelong health.
Excellence & Innovation
We strive to achieve and surpass national standards by benchmarking our practices.
We create a culture that fosters the development of new and diverse programs and services
                        that exceed our perceived potential.
Intentional Collaboration
We will create and sustain relationships within #OneUSF, the surrounding communities,
                        and global partners.
We enhance and support other USF departments by sharing resources and educational
                        opportunities.
Assumption of Risk
All individuals who participate in Recreation & Wellness activities will be doing
               so at their own risk. These risks could include, but are not limited to, muscle cramps,
               nausea, fainting, abnormal blood pressure, chest discomfort, and even death. The University
               of South Florida and its Board of Trustees are not responsible for any injury that
               may occur to individuals participating in any Recreation & Wellness activity. Participation
               in any Recreation & Wellness activity is on a purely voluntary basis. Individuals
               are encouraged to have a physical examination and obtain adequate health and accident
               insurance
prior to participation
in all Recreation & Wellness activities.

Board of Trustees | University of South Florida
About
The USF Board of Trustees is the public body corporate of the university. It sets
         cost-effective policy for the institution and serves as the legal owner and governing
         board. The Board of Trustees is responsible for high quality education programs within
         the laws of the State of Florida and regulations of the Florida Board of Governors.
         It holds the institution’s resources in trust and is responsible for their efficient
         and effective use as per Florida Statute 1.001 University Board of Trustees Powers
         and Duties.
The Board of Trustees is comprised of thirteen members, six whom are appointed by
         the Florida Governor and five whom are appointed by the Florida Board of Governors
         and confirmed by the Florida Senate for a term of five years. The elected Faculty
         Senate President and Student Government President also serve as trustees.
